question: Where can I see documentation around scenarios?
answer: We are publishing our business process diagrams in the Street Manager documentation site and will be providing some test scenarios to private beta users.

question: How do I know when a work has been updated and what the change is?
answer: See the API documentation - Technical Overview - Getting data from Street Manager. We expose a Reporting API "/works/updates" endpoint for polling Street Manager for changes to works.

question: How do I know when a work has been created on a Street or in an area of interest related to my organisation?
answer: We have exposed the GeoJSON API so you can now query Street Manager via the API to find any works within defined spatial bounds and a date range. We are also looking at exposing filtering options within the Reporting API to define and query based on pre-defined areas of interest.

question: Will Fee Reporting cover section 74?
answer: Initially this will need to be a comment. Later we will move towards introducing Defects which will include section 74.

question: Will you preserve data entered for works during private beta going into public beta?
answer: Yes, data entered for production use during private beta will be preserved.

question: Will Street Manager support API push notifications?
answer: Not for MVP in public beta. Push notification are in the roadmap for later phases.

question: Will Street Manager support historic data?
answer: Street Manager will not support migrating historic works data.

question: How resilient will the Street Manager be to prevent outages?
answer: Street Manager will be hosted across multiple AWS London regions, with multiple instances of each web/API node available. The underlying platform is designed to leverage cloud-native elasticity and resiliency features to ensure Street Manager can auto-scale with demand, and auto-heal from major systems failures.

question: How will I tell if one of my works has been updated?
answer: There is a work events endpoint available in the reporting API which allows polling for updates.

question: Does the works event endpoint return all event data for the work?
answer: No, only the latest change. To get the full event data you must retrieve the work history via the work API.

question: Will Street Manager capture all history related to a work? Inspections, Comments, FPNs etc.
answer: Yes, Street Manager records all changes to works in the Work History.

question: How do I retrieve a file linked to a work?
answer: You retrieve the list of files associated with a work and call the work API to download the file using the file ID.

question: Will there be downtime when you are updating NSG data in Street Manager?
answer: No, Street Manager will update the NSG data as a background task without disrupting normal use.

question: How will Street Manager handle changes to street data from the NSG?
answer: NSG data will be taken at the point the Permit is submitted and saved against the work so there is a record of what it was at the time it was submitted.

question: Will the data from the API contain the USRN and ESU IDs?
answer: Work data will include the USRN, we have access to the ESUs and use them for querying NSG data for closest street to a location.

question: Will we be able to get spatial data, such as the start/end locations of road works, diversionary routes and traffic management from the API?
answer: Yes, we record and store the Work Area geometry and return it as GeoJSON in work data.

question: What will the data licencing be around the NSG data?
answer: USRN and NSG data is maintained by GeoPlace and all authorised Street Works Authorities have rights to use it in relation to their legislative requirements for permitting/noticing.
